intro: Hieracium hesperium, commonly known as the western meadowhawk, is a flowering plant belonging to the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. It has hairy stems and leaves that are usually alternate and lance-shaped. Hieracium hesperium is often found in the western United States and is adapted to a variety of soil types.
